text: I know that there is caching, but the cachebuster was working for me on staged pages around 5pm yesterday.
I think it may have evolved a resistance to cache busting.
This was late last night.
hmm, odd I’ll watch for it today - I doubt that is the case though, because HubSpot has no reason to actively try to prevent the cachebuster method from working

in-fact they benefit from it being used in a way.

Server side they log when someone uses the cachebuster, they can then review the page later and see what type of content is on the page to figure out why someone needed to do it, as in what part of the CMS didn’t clear it’s cache
Maybe it was an error with pushing the code up.

I am wondering about copy template/modules between portals, is there a way to copy a whole folder in design manager, not shift+clicking all templates and modules in different folders, when I right-click a folder in Design manager there is no options to clone the whole folder, seems like that is something that should be activated or available
You can try doing it via FTP and copying all the templates/modules over that way
only thing is i think marketplace based purchases wouldnt be able to be transferred
I tried that, and it does not let me
the permissions fail
I tried changing permissions and it would not
so I pulled all my modules/templates down to my local machine, then in ftp went to my new portal folder and tried to copy them over to modules folder and it did not let me
try making yourself a superadmin on both portals, if you still have issues from there with permissions i would reach out to HS support on it as you should be able to do it with a superadmin role
its a test portal, like a DEV portal and I am the owner
I am super admin on this test portal
:thinking_face: well im out of ideas lol, thats got me stumped. I would wait and see if any of the HS folks can chime in. I would also send in a support ticket as well to HS.
you can also try this forum <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/> as this is where alot of the HS staff dev hangout/assist people
<@UDX10MWBZ>, maybe we can discuss this in our meeting on Wed, I tried to use FTP to copy module/templates over to my test portal but permissions would not let me even though I am Super Admin
you can add all of your modules to a template and copy that to your portal.  it would at least move all of the modules
not perfect, i know
Sorry for the late reply on this. You should check out seventh sense. It may help with this functionality an integrates into HubSpot
so ur saying I create template, and then literally just drop every single module into that template through drag-n-drop then copy just that template?
yep
it will also copy any css and js files associated with it
wish when you copied it the modules would stay in the same folder, but they dont
if you are organized on your dev setup, you should spot em quickly though

<@UD53A9UUR>, this new design manager is really hard to use, like selecting multiple modules at once in different folders, I started with a few modules, but I have would have to manually click and drag over 50+ modules, I cannot shift click, each time it unselects what I try selecting
yea, we’ve glanced at that, might be the way we need to go - just want to avoid it if we can
that is annoying and i dont have a solve for that.  I can say that i keep a template with all my modules and add them as i build new
got it, happy to make the intro of you would like
they're good people
you will have a bit of a lift with 50+
try FTP then
said he was having issues with ftp

If the client decides to go that route I’ll let you know, it’s unlikely though(they’re a bit weird financially, they’re loaded but they act really cheap on weird things and I see this being something they’re not gonna want to pay extra for.) even though logically I think they should just bite the bullet and do it
dang ok so maybe its then allocating time to create this template since DM does not let you copy folders to other portals, seems like that should be an option when you right click a folder in DM
oh sorry didn’t read that
probably a way to do it using the HS API but :shrug:  probably not easier/faster
so with HS API, I now there is a CMS Templates API but what is the CMS Modules API? is there documentation to use the API’s for copying between portals, because that would be helpful documentation
no rush, but WHEN!
I don't believe we have an API for custom modules at this time.
For the email limits inside of the Products and Services area, is this a monthly quota I am assuming?
like this client gets 30,000 emails total a month?
Late next week or early the week after!
huzzah!
Yup, those are monthly quotas :slightly_smiling_face:
awesome, thanks James!
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1546963083020600?thread_ts=1546962371.020500&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

<@U7SL518D6> yeah I am getting permission issues trying to copy over to a Test portal I created, I am the Super Admin on the test portal, I have tried Cyberduck and Filezilla, both do not let me copy my modules (which I have copied down to my computer) into the “modules” folder, is this a known bug, have you been able to do this?

well I’ve never personally tried copying modules to another portal via FTP.

Usually copy to portals is sufficient for me.

Does anyone have experience working with adding Stripe forms to HubSpot pages and transferring all that data? We've worked on a few Stripe projects now and I'm really trying to figure out better ways to make this all work since we seem to burn a gross amount of dev hours just getting Stripe setup.
Sorry guys, we've chosen a candidate.
i just did an integration with stripe using depositfix.  worked pretty well
I remember looking at DepositFix a while ago but never committed for some reason. Might be worth looking at again. Thanks Dennis!
Depositfix and landing pay are great
landingpay sure is a lot cheaper. Never heard of them until now though, so thanks for the suggestion <@U25C65C3S>
the docs for depositfix are not so hot.  I was able to contact the dev directly and got help quickly.
Got it, thanks for the heads up
and another little helper if you need multiple products in a form: `<https://gist.github.com/denlunev/30dcf5dde3b20a14bbdd9ba85d8a73ff#file-multiple_products-html-L10>`

Dennis, would that be similar to something like having a simple shopping cart? we have a client that needs to allow people to purchase mutliple distinct items in one go, so that should  be covered by that link you gave?
that only allows you to have several product options.  if you need a more ecommerce solution, this will probably not be for you.
Got it, thanks

I’m finding that HubSpot forms are now injecting style tags and styles even if “keep the old theme” is flagged in the HubSpot Form editor. *Is there a way to prevent these styles from getting injected via the hubl Form code?*

*Update - it was my bad I was using the javascript embed code instead, forgot, had a crazy implementation on this page*

Not quite sure where this question should go so I will slap it in general.

*Has anyone figured out a good way to implement editable buttons in email templates?* I am in the process of developing some email templates for one of our clients and they like the drag and drop editor currently because they can pretty easily just whip up buttons and well drag and drop things all over. However, to streamline their process they asked me to build them some templates but I notice that HS's email editor supports only CTA from the rich text editor. How might I go about creating a simple button module that can be toggled/moved around as well as also being able to change the destination of the link? Does that make sense?

Thanks for the help!
